title: Calories in 2 Tbsp Butter
meta_description: Discover calories in 2 tbsp butter, including full nutrition breakdown like fat, sodium, and quick tweaks for variations in your recipes.
assumptions: Standard salted butter; 1 tbsp â‰ˆ14 g or 0.5 oz; melted or solid form similar nutritionally.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, salted vs. unsalted, and fat content (e.g., grass-fed). Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 2 tablespoons of butter provide about 204 calories, mostly from 23 g of fat.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Switch to light butter (50% less fat)

faqs.q: How many calories in 1 tbsp of butter?
faqs.a: About 102 calories per tablespoon of standard butter.

faqs.q: Is butter high in saturated fat?
faqs.a: Yes, 2 tbsp has 14.6 g saturated fat, which is significant for heart health monitoring.

faqs.q: Does unsalted butter have fewer calories than salted?
faqs.a: No, calories are the same; only sodium differs (unsalted has ~2 mg vs. 91 mg per tbsp).

faqs.q: What are the carbs in 2 tbsp butter?
faqs.a: Zero carbs, making it keto-friendly but watch the fat content.

faqs.q: How does butter compare to margarine in calories?
faqs.a: Similar at ~100 kcal per tbsp, but margarine often has less saturated fat and trans fats.
